stories.title: Which toml package to use in Python?

stories.text:
Many books that I've read explain about Pareto rules, if the same would be applied to cyber security which ones are the most efficient?

Just heard company I work for spent a huge amount of money so just got interested how they spent it.

First I thought about DX Connect, separate infra from the public internet that would be beneficial but how about its BCR?

Thanks.
stories.title: Ask HN: What is the best BCR investment company can make in cyber security?

stories.text:
Is there a library written in Rust providing comparable functionality to the cmux golang package?

> cmux is a generic Go library to multiplex connections based on their payload. Using cmux, you can serve gRPC, SSH, HTTPS, HTTP, Go RPC, and pretty much any other protocol on the same TCP listener.

https://github.com/soheilhy/cmux
stories.title: Ask HN: Does this exist: cmux-like TCP multiplexer in Rust?
Job interest in Twitter skyrocketed more than 250% since Elon Musk move
Boeing Plans to Relocate Its Headquarters to Virginia from Chicago
Boeing will move its headquarters to DC area from Chicago

stories.text:
I listen to a lot of audiobooks—some of them ripped straight from CDs in lossless quality—on a pair of Airmotiv 4S speakers. While these are far from the best speakers money can buy, most reviews consider them to be high quality studio monitors, appropriate for use by professional audio engineers. (I am not a professional audio engineer.)

I would generally expect these speakers to be overkill for spoken-word content. However, although they do make audiobooks sound quite good, I can definitely tell that these recordings are being played back on a pair of speakers. I would never mistake them for a person who is physically in the room with me.

Why? Would it be possible to create an audio setup which makes spoken-word content indistinguishable from a real person? In other words, if my eyes are closed, I shouldn't be able to tell the difference between electronic speakers and a human sitting next to me.

What would it take? Does it come down to the speakers, or how the audio is mastered, or something else?
stories.title: Ask HN: Life-like audio setup for spoken-word content?
